%text If $f(x)$ and $g(x)$ be two functions such that \underline\text{both} $\lim_{x\to a}f(x)$ and $\lim_{x\to a} g(x)$ exist, then
% \begin{align} \lim_{x\to a}\left[f(x) + g(x)\right] &= \lim_{x\to a}f(x) + \lim_{x\to a}g(x) \\ \lim_{x\to a}\left[f(x) - g(x)\right] &= \lim_{x\to a}f(x) - \lim_{x\to a}g(x) \end{align}
